questions.question: What is the length of the FIR of the channel?

explanations.a: Incorrect. N is the number of subcarriers in OFDM, not the channel length.
explanations.b: Incorrect. N+μ is the total length of the OFDM block with cyclic prefix.
explanations.c: Incorrect. N+μ−1 is not a standard representation of the channel length.
explanations.d: Correct. The FIR length of the channel is μ.

questions.question: Which one of the following is NOT correct in the context of OFDM?

answers.a: We consider flat fading over the channel corresponding to each sub-carrier
answers.b: We consider flat fading over the entire channel
answers.c: This scheme provides efficient bandwidth usage
answers.d: This scheme can be used in a MIMO system to achieve frequency as well as spatial multiplexing

explanations.a: Correct. Each sub-carrier experiences flat fading due to narrowband division.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This is false—OFDM divides the wideband channel into flat fading narrowband sub-carriers.
explanations.c: Correct. OFDM offers efficient use of bandwidth by overlapping subcarriers orthogonally.
explanations.d: Correct. OFDM is compatible with MIMO for both frequency and spatial multiplexing gains.

questions.question: What is the rate of this scheme (in number of QAM symbols per sampling time)?

explanations.a: Incorrect. N+μ is the total number of samples per block, including cyclic prefix.
explanations.b: Incorrect. μ is just the cyclic prefix length and does not represent symbol rate.
explanations.c: Correct. The system transmits N QAM symbols in N+μ samples, giving a rate of N/(N+μ) ≈ N per sample time.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Option c is the correct representation.
